snippet: The case, whose arguments were heard in Boston on Wednesday, is the first challenge to the Defense of Marriage Act to reach a federal appeals court.
abstract: Federal appeals court in Boston hears arguments on whether to uphold a lower court’s finding that a section of the 1996 law banning federal recognition of same-sex marriage is unconstitutional; case is the first challenge to the so-called Defense of Marriage Act, or DOMA, to reach a federal appeals court.
